Module mirchandani.schedulingsystem
Package dao

Class AppointmentDao

java.lang.Object
dao.AppointmentDao
public abstract class AppointmentDao extends Object
Class AppointmentsDao is used to perform a number of actions for managing appointments. It contains methods for getting observable lists of all appointments, and for appointments starting within seven days and thirty days. It contains methods to insert, update and delete appointments from the client_schedule MySQL database. It also contains methods to return lists of appointments filtered by type, month, contact, and customer ID.

    • insertAppointment

      public static int insertAppointment(String title, String description, String location, String type, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, int customerId, int userId, int contactId) throws SQLException
      This method inserts a new appointment record into the appointments table of the client_schedule MySQL database.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the appointment.
      description - the description of the appointment.
      location - the location of the appointment.
      type - the type of the appointment.
      start - the start date and time of the appointment.
      end - the end date and time of the appointment.
      customerId - the customer ID associated with the appointment.
      userId - the user ID associated with the appointment.
      contactId - the contact ID associated with the appointment.
      Returns:
      the number of rows inserted
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • updateAppointment

      public static int updateAppointment(int appointmentId, String title, String description, String location, String type, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, int customerId, int userId, int contactId) throws SQLException
      This method updates an existing appointment record with each column value passed into it.
      Parameters:
      appointmentId - the appointment ID of the appointment.
      title - the title of the appointment.
      description - the description of the appointment.
      location - the location of the appointment.
      type - the type of the appointment.
      start - the start date and time of the appointment.
      end - the end date and time of the appointment.
      customerId - the customer ID associated with the appointment.
      userId - the user ID associated with the appointment.
      contactId - the contact ID associated with the appointment.
      Returns:
      the number of rows updated
      Throws:
      SQLException
